intro: Hieracium diabaeum, commonly known as the devil's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features bright yellow flowers that are surrounded by a series of pale green to white bracts, creating a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Hieracium diabaeum is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in challenging environmental conditions.
